text.p: True or false: It is possible for two non-invertible matrices to have an invertible product.

font.p: The proposition proven on the previous pages states that if the product of two square matrices is invertible, then each individual matrix is. However, this problem does not indicate that the matrices are square.

we find that [mathjaxinline]AB[/mathjaxinline] is the [mathjaxinline]2\times 2[/mathjaxinline] identity matrix, which is invertible, yet neither [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] nor [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline] are invertible.
